meanings.definition: Existing or lasting for all time; permanent
meanings.sent1: The stars in the sky are eternals, shining brightly every night.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins are a reminder of the eternals of history.
meanings.sent3: The eternal flame in the temple never goes out, even during storms.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like an eternal flame, never fading or flickering.
meanings.sent5: The majestic mountains stood as eternals, unmoved by the passing of time.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is eternal
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of powerful eternals who walk among us.
meanings.sent2: The concept of love is often associated with the idea of eternals.
meanings.sent3: In the fantasy novel, the hero seeks the aid of the eternals to defeat the dark lord.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the twins was like an unbreakable chain, an eternal connection.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of eternity, portraying the figures as eternals.

meanings.sent1: In many religions, believers worship the eternals as divine beings.
meanings.sent2: The eternal God is said to watch over all living creatures.
meanings.sent3: The eternal God chuckled at the antics of the mischievous angels.
meanings.sent4: His wisdom was like that of the eternal God, guiding others with grace.
meanings.sent5: The eternal God's presence filled the temple with a sense of peace and serenity.
